010package imagingbook.common.math.eigen;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
017
018import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
019
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * Implements an efficient, closed form algorithm for calculating the real
024 * eigenvalues (&lambda;) and eigenvectors (x) of a 2x2 matrix of the form
025 * </p>
026 * 
027 * <pre>
028 *   | a b |
029 *   | c d |
030 * </pre>
031 * <p>
032 * There are typically (but not always) two pairs of real-valued solutions
033 * &lang;&lambda;<sub>0</sub>, x<sub>0</sub>&rang;, &lang;&lambda;<sub>1</sub>,
034 * x<sub>1</sub>&rang; such that A&middot;x<sub>k</sub> =
035 * &lambda;<sub>k</sub>&middot;x<sub>k</sub>. The resulting eigensystems are
036 * ordered such that &lambda;<sub>0</sub> &ge; &lambda;<sub>1</sub>.
037 * Eigenvectors are not normalized, i.e., no unit vectors (any scalar multiple
038 * of an Eigenvector is an Eigenvector too). Non-real eigenvalues are not
039 * handled. Clients should call method {@link #hasComplexEigenvalues()} to check
040 * if the eigenvalue calculation was successful.
041 * </p>
042 * <p>
043 * This implementation is inspired by Ch. 5 ("Consider the Lowly 2x2 Matrix") of
044 * [1]. Note that Blinn uses the notation x&middot;A = &lambda;&middot;x for the
045 * matrix-vector product (as common in computer graphics), while this
046 * implementation uses A&middot;x = &lambda;&middot;x. Thus x is treated as a
047 * column vector and matrix A is transposed (elements b/c are exchanged). See
048 * Appendix Sec. B.5 of [2] for more details.
049 * </p>
050 * <p>
051 * This implementation is considerably faster (ca. factor 5) than the general
052 * solution (e.g., {@link EigenDecompositionJama}) for 2x2 matrices.
053 * </p>
054 * <p>
055 * [1] Blinn, Jim: "Jim Blinn's Corner: Notation, Notation, Notation", Morgan
056 * Kaufmann (2002). <br>
057 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
058 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
059 * </p>
060 * 
061 * @author WB
062 * @version 2022/02/18
063 * 
064 * @see EigenDecompositionJama
065 * @see EigenDecompositionApache
066 * 
067 */
068public class Eigensolver2x2 implements RealEigenDecomposition { // to check: http://www.akiti.ca/Eig2Solv.html
069        
070        private final boolean isReal;
071        private final double[] eVals = {Double.NaN, Double.NaN};
072        private final double[][] eVecs = new double[2][];
073        
074        /**
075         * Constructor, takes a 2x2 matrix.
076         * @param A a 2x2 matrix
077         */
078        public Eigensolver2x2(double[][] A) {
079                this(A[0][0], A[0][1], A[1][0], A[1][1]);
080                if (Matrix.getNumberOfRows(A) != 2 || Matrix.getNumberOfColumns(A) != 2) {
081                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix not of size 2x2");
082                }
083        }
084        
085        /**
086         * Constructor, takes the individual elements of a 2x2 matrix A:
087         * <pre>
088         *   | a b |
089         *   | c d | </pre>
090         * @param a matrix element A[0,0]
091         * @param b matrix element A[0,1]
092         * @param c matrix element A[1,0]
093         * @param d matrix element A[1,1]
094         */
095        public Eigensolver2x2(double a, double b, double c, double d) {
096                isReal = solve(a, b, c, d);
097        }
098        
099        private boolean solve(final double a, final double b, final double c, final double d) {
100                final double R = (a + d) / 2;
101                final double S = (a - d) / 2;
102                final double rho = sqr(S) + b * c;
103                
104                if (rho < 0) {  
105                        return false;           // no real-valued eigenvalues
106                }
107                
108                final double T = Math.sqrt(rho);
109                final double lambda0 = R + T;   // eigenvalue 0
110                final double lambda1 = R - T;   // eigenvalue 1
111                final double[] x0, x1;                  // eigenvectors 0, 1
112                
113                if (a - d > 0) {
114//                      System.out.println("Case 1");
115                        x0 = new double[] {S + T, c};
116                        x1 = new double[] {b, -(S + T)};
117                }
118                else if (a - d < 0) {
119//                      System.out.println("Case 2");
120                        x0 = new double[] {b, -S + T};
121                        x1 = new double[] {S - T, c};
122                }
123                else {          // (A - D) == 0
124//                      System.out.println("Case 3");
125                        final double bA = Math.abs(b);
126                        final double cA = Math.abs(c);
127                        final double bcR = Math.sqrt(b * c);
128                        if (bA < cA) {                                                  // |b| < |c|
129//                              System.out.println("Case 3a");
130                                x0 = new double[] { bcR, c};
131                                x1 = new double[] {-bcR, c};
132                        }
133                        else if (bA > cA) {                                     // |b| > |c|
134//                              System.out.println("Case 3b");
135                                x0 = new double[] {b,  bcR};
136                                x1 = new double[] {b, -bcR};
137                        }
138                        else {  // |B| == |C| and B,C must have the same sign
139//                              System.out.println("Case 3c");
140                                if (cA > 0) {   // 
141                                        x0 = new double[] { c, c};
142                                        x1 = new double[] {-c, c};
143                                }
144                                else { // B = C = 0; any vector is an eigenvector (we don't return trivial zero vectors)
145                                        x0 = new double[] { 0, 1};      // pick 2 arbitrary, orthogonal vectors
146                                        x1 = new double[] { 1, 0};
147                                }
148                        }
149                }
150                
151                eVals[0] = lambda0;
152                eVals[1] = lambda1;
153                eVecs[0] = x0;
154                eVecs[1] = x1;
155                
156                // lambda0 >= lambda1, no need to sort by magnitude
157                
158//              if (Math.abs(lambda0) >= Math.abs(lambda1)) {   // order eigenvalues by magnitude
159//                      eVals[0] = lambda0;
160//                      eVals[1] = lambda1;
161//                      eVecs[0] = x0;
162//                      eVecs[1] = x1;
163//              }
164//              else {
165//                      eVals[0] = lambda1;
166//                      eVals[1] = lambda0;
167//                      eVecs[0] = x1;
168//                      eVecs[1] = x0;
169//              }
170                return true;    // real eigenvalues
171        }
172        
173        
174//      public boolean isReal() {
175//              return isReal;
176//      }
177        
178        @Override
179        public boolean hasComplexEigenvalues() {
180                return !isReal;
181        }
182        
183        @Override
184        public double[] getRealEigenvalues() {
185                return eVals;
186        }
187        
188        @Override
189        public double getRealEigenvalue(int k) {
190                return eVals[k];
191        }
192        
193        @Override
194        public RealMatrix getV() {
195                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(Matrix.transpose(eVecs));
196        }
197        
198        @Override
199        public RealVector getEigenvector(int k) {
200                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(eVecs[k]);
201        }
202        
203        @Override
204        public String toString() {
205                if (this.isReal) {
206                        return String.format("<%.4f, %.4f, %s, %s>", 
207                                eVals[0], eVals[1], Matrix.toString(eVecs[0]), Matrix.toString(eVecs[1]));
208                }
209                else {
210                        return "<not real>";
211                }
212        }
213
214                
215}
